{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3621095,"name":"Justin Buist","username":"Justin_Buist","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-11T23:41:09.161Z","cooked":"

I like magicbot but incompatibility with the command framework that libraries heavily rely upon has been a source of resistance on my team this year. I’m thinking of things like PlathPlanner or CTRE’s Swerve Generator. While I don’t mind rolling our own swerve or just following a PP trajectory without a pre-made command it’s a lot less ‘follow the bouncy ball’ in instructions on how you get there and I could see where some teams might balk at that.

So I see some merit in being able to merge the two. Like maybe your drivetrain is a command2 based subsystem, because that’s where the legacy stuff is at, but everything else could be a nice shiny magicbot component. A stepping stone idea of sorts.

With that I put together a little demo, mostly just to see how it would look for myself, but thought I’d share it with the group. It’s just a tiny fake robot that will print messages on the console in sim. There’s one MagicBot component running and one Subsystem with a default command. A button press creates a new command that takes over the subsystem.

github.com

GitHub - justinb4003/magicbot-command: A work in progress of integrating magicbot and...

A work in progress of integrating magicbot and commands2 in wpilib

It’s just an example and I assume I’ve missed something since I’m not too into command2 architecture, though I’ve used it in Java and Python. I much prefer magicbot’s general format but I feel like it might be easier for some teams if the two were side-by-side.

Open to thoughts.

We had a similar battle this season with pathplanner and ended up reading choreo files and using pid+a series of feedforwards to track along the path. It worked well for us but it’s definitely not a sustainable solution for a lot of teams.

I also think it would be good to have some integration with commands: magicbot: provide mechanism to run commands · Issue #215 · robotpy/robotpy-wpilib-utilities · GitHub

… your example seems too simple, but thinking about it I guess there’s no reason it wouldn’t work?

I also have been working on intigrating commands v2 in magic bot (I probably should have posted about it now that I think about it) I did get the swerve generator working in magic bot but there are still bugs as I’m just messing around and seeing what works. There’s also some stuff in there that’s not needed probably but this is what I did https://github.com/FRC5113/LemonLib/tree/main/lemonlib/lemonbot
